content: Has anyone ever been charged for going over your weight limit for House Hold Goods? Is there a statute of limitations on charging for going over your limit?
reply: Has anyone ever been charged for going over your weight limit for House Hold Goods? Is there a statute of limitations on charging for going over your limit?
title: House Hold Goods

content: If you talk to your Admin people, they can show you the HHG rules. And if you do go over your allowed weight the moving company will send you a bill.
reply: If you talk to your Admin people, they can show you the HHG rules. And if you do go over your allowed weight the moving company will send you a bill.
title: House Hold Goods

content: The company rep. from the moving company makes an estimate of weight from the amount of furniture that is to be moved. He/she also should ask the client if the house they are moving to is aways off the main road and if there stairs. There is a charge for that. When we moved, we did not know how far the house was from the main road. the estimater did not ask us. The mover told us the estimater should have asked, since he didn't ask, there would be no charge. We leased the home sight unseen, since this was an interstate move. We communicated by phone with the home owner, we didn't ask if the home was not close to the main road, nor did we ask if there were steps. There were only two steps to the deck, but the mover charges extra anyway! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
